Articles.Content: Does anyone have any 2-color (land, liquid) maps of Eve and/or Laythe? I've been looking for some in order to do things involving colonization.

It is not 2 colors but you can have a look at http://www.kerbalmaps.com/

Edit: a bit of photoshop/gimp should easily select all the water (as it's the same color), and then the inverse selection should get the land.
I already know about Kerbalmaps and I found it useless for these purposes.

I already know about Kerbalmaps and I found it useless for these purposes.

Can you tell us why it's useless?

You might want to try getting RSS and running an export on the planets. Instructions in the thread somewhere.

Can you tell us why it's useless?

You might want to try getting RSS and running an export on the planets. Instructions in the thread somewhere.

Kerbalmaps is useless for these purposes because I cannot recolor all of the colors without affecting the ocean colors. RSS I can't do because I'd rather not go through multiple 300+ page threads and I'm not all that keen for another throwaway KSP download.

Edited July 2, 2014 by Tangle

because I cannot recolor all of the colors without affecting the ocean colors

All my wats

Kerbalmaps is useless for these purposes because I cannot recolor all of the colors without affecting the ocean colors. RSS I can't do because I'd rather not go through multiple 300+ page threads and I'm not all that keen for another throwaway KSP download.

Sounds like you wrestle well, then. Maybe try the slope setting on Kerbal Maps?
You should be able to use the Magic Wand selection tool in Photoshop or Paint.net to select Eve's oceans and recolor them before changing the land color to something uniform.
Regex is correct: you must want to be helped in order to be helped.

You should be able to use the Magic Wand selection tool in Photoshop or Paint.net to select Eve's oceans and recolor them before changing the land color to something uniform.

I tried. With Laythe, it decided to select some of the land too.

I tried. With Laythe, it decided to select some of the land too.

The permissiveness of the tool is adjustable, try making it stricter.

Kerbalmaps is useless for these purposes because I cannot recolor all of the colors without affecting the ocean colors. RSS I can't do because I'd rather not go through multiple 300+ page threads and I'm not all that keen for another throwaway KSP download.

No offence, but this has absolutely nothing to do with kerbalmaps.com but rather everything with you and/or your image editing software.
Are we still asking for the maps? If so, I made some just now:

Thank you so much!

No prob!

so op just wants a 2 tone map?

edit: oh he got it on page 2. very well then.
